name: squirrelly
content:
squirrelly adjective
(LIKE ANIMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to or similar to a squirrel (= a small furry animal with a thick long tail that climbs trees): I'm not keen on her squirrelly food choices. Tom is a pot-bellied man with a squirrelly little moustache.

squirrelly adjective
(NERVOUS)
US informal nervous and unable to stay still and calm : I could tell right away that the girls were squirrelly and unusually frantic. Like lots of people, I get squirrelly when I'm forced to leave a message. I get a little squirrelly if I'm stuck in the house all day.

squirrelly adjective
(DISHONEST)
US informal not completely honest, or not to be trusted: There's something a little squirrelly about the whole thing. Some of the numbers in the preliminary report look squirrelly. The driver was acting squirrelly about his insurance information.
